text.0: he in the ancient way by strength engendered lo straight hath taken to himself all wisdom.
text.1: the waters and the bowl have made him friendly the gods possessed the wealth bestowing agni.
text.2: at Āyus ancient call he by his wisdom gave all this progeny of men their being.
text.3: and by refulgent light heaven and the waters the gods possessed the wealth bestowing agni.
text.4: praise him ye Āryan folk as chief performer of sacrifice adored and ever toiling.
text.5: welltended son of strength the constant giver the gods possessed the wealth bestowing agni.
text.6: that mātariśvan rich in wealth and treasure lightwinner finds a pathway for his offspring.
text.7: guard of our folk father of earth and heaven the gods possessed the wealth bestowing agni.
text.8: night and dawn changing each the others colour meeting together suckle one same infant.
text.9: golden between the heaven and earth he shineth the gods possessed the wealth bestowing agni.
text.10: root of wealth gatheringplace of treasures banner of sacrifice who grants the suppliants wishes.
text.11: preserving him as their own life immortal the gods possessed the wealthbestowing agni.
text.12: now and of old the home of wealth the mansion of what is born and what was born aforetime.
text.13: guard of what is and what will be hereafterthe gods possessed the wealth bestowing agni.
text.14: may the wealthgiver grant us conquering riches may the wealthgiver grant us wealth with heroes.
text.15: may the wealthgiver grant us food with offspring and length of days may the wealthgiver send us.
text.16: fed with our fuel purifying agni so blaze to us auspiciously for glory.
text.17: this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
